title: Data Access
text: The project team is committed to supporting future work related to the socioeconomic resilience of small scale fisheries in Maine and beyond. As part of that commitment, we are happy to share the data sets and corresponding code used to conduct our analyses.

title: Data Access
text:
Data Request
Complete this form to submit a data request to our team.

title: Data Access
text:
gomfish R package
In August of 2023, we will be releasing an R package to host many of the fisheries and community data sets used in this work. Please check back here for updates or send an email to theresa.burnham@maine.edu if you would like to be notified of its release.

title: Learn More
text:
Join Our Open Meetings
We host regular open meetings to share our progress and gather feedback from anyone who is interested in this work. If you would like to be added to our invitation list for those meetings, please submit your information here.


Request A Briefing
To learn more about our project, or request a briefing for your research group you can email Theresa Burnham: theresa.burnham@maine.edu

title: American Lobster Fishery Social Indicators Project
Social Indicators
text:
This collaborative project has led to the development of 8 social indicators. Each indicator aims to describe a different component of the socioeconomic status of the lobster fishery that cannot necessarily be measured directly, but may be able to be described by combining different types of data. Each of the following indicators was identified by the Maine fishermen and industry professionals that we interviewed as important for monitoring socioeconomic resilience of the fishery. See our Methods section to learn more.
Each of our indicators has been categorized as data rich, data limited, or data poor depending upon the number and quality of the data sets that were collected to describe it. However, an indicator’s data status is not a measure of its importance, but does identify opportunities for gathering new data sources to enhance the data quality of all indicators.

title: Social Indicators
text:
